intro: Talipariti tiliaceum var. chihsinlinensis, commonly known as the Chihsinlin's tiliaceum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in East Asia. It belongs to the family Tiliaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features include small, ovate leaves and a woody stem, which contribute to its adaptation to humid climates. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
